name: Sao Tome and Principe
description: Sao Tome and Principe, an island nation in the Gulf of Guinea, off the western equatorial coast of Central Africa, boasts a unique blend of volcanic landscapes, lush rainforests, and a rich, complex history shaped by Portuguese colonization and a vibrant Creole culture. The islands are renowned for their biodiversity, cocoa production, and stunning natural beauty.  The twin islands, Sao Tome and Principe, offer a tranquil escape with opportunities for ecotourism, adventure, and cultural immersion.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The political and economic center of the nation.
quickFacts.detail: Sao Tome is a bustling city with a historic colonial center and a vibrant market scene.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A relatively small and close-knit population.
quickFacts.detail: The population is predominantly of mixed African and Portuguese descent, speaking Portuguese and various Creole languages.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Comprising two main islands and numerous islets.
quickFacts.detail: Sao Tome is the larger island, covering approximately 80% of the total land area.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The local currency of Sao Tome and Principe.
quickFacts.detail: The dobra is pegged to the Portuguese Escudo, but is increasingly used in local transactions.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The language of administration and education.
quickFacts.detail: Creole languages, such as Forro and Sato, are also widely spoken.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: A developing economy reliant on cocoa and tourism.
quickFacts.detail: The economy is heavily influenced by the cocoa industry, though diversification efforts are underway.

climateData.title: Tropical Rainforest Climate
climateData.description: Sao Tome and Principe experiences a tropical rainforest climate, characterized by consistently high temperatures and humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant, particularly during the wet season, contributing to the islands' lush vegetation.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This period is marked by frequent heavy rainfall, often accompanied by thunderstorms and strong winds. Rivers swell, and landslides are possible.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season brings calmer weather, with reduced rainfall and lower humidity. Temperatures remain warm, but there are more sunny days.

naturalWonders.name: Pico Grande
naturalWonders.description: Pico Grande is the highest point on Sao Tome, a dramatic volcanic peak shrouded in mist and offering breathtaking panoramic views of the island. Its rugged slopes are home to unique flora and fauna.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The peak is accessible via a challenging hike, rewarding adventurers with unparalleled vistas. The surrounding area is a protected natural park, preserving the island's volcanic heritage.

naturalWonders.name: Obo National Park
naturalWonders.description: Obo National Park is a vast expanse of primary rainforest, teeming with biodiversity and offering a glimpse into the islands' natural heritage. It's a crucial habitat for endemic species and a vital carbon sink.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park’s diverse ecosystems range from lowland rainforest to montane forests, supporting a rich array of plant and animal life.  It’s a challenging but rewarding destination for experienced hikers and nature enthusiasts.

naturalWonders.name: Praia Banana
naturalWonders.description: Praia Banana, meaning 'Banana Beach', is a stunning crescent-shaped beach on Principe Island, renowned for its pristine white sand and turquoise waters. It’s a popular spot for swimming, sunbathing, and enjoying the natural beauty of the islands.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The beach is sheltered by lush vegetation, creating a tranquil and idyllic setting.  The surrounding waters are rich in marine life, making it a great location for snorkeling and diving.
viewingTips: Consider a boat trip to nearby islands

ecosystemData.title: Island Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Sao Tome and Principe’s unique island ecosystem is characterized by its high levels of endemism – species found nowhere else on Earth. The islands’ volcanic origins, isolation, and diverse habitats have fostered a remarkable array of flora and fauna.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: The islands are a haven for birdwatchers, boasting a diverse range of endemic and migratory species.

statistics.details: Many species are found only on Sao Tome and Principe.
The islands serve as a crucial stopover for migratory birds.

notableSpecies.name: Sao Tome Fiscal
notableSpecies.significance: A critically endangered endemic bird species.

notableSpecies.name: Principe Thrush
notableSpecies.significance: A rare thrush found only on Principe Island.

biodiversityCategories.name: Reptiles & Amphibians
biodiversityCategories.description: The islands are home to a variety of reptiles and amphibians, many of which are endemic to the region.

statistics.details: Several lizard and snake species are unique to Sao Tome and Principe.
Limited amphibian diversity, with several endemic frog species.

notableSpecies.name: Sao Tome Chameleon
notableSpecies.significance: A distinctive chameleon species with vibrant coloration.

activities.title: Outdoor Adventures
activities.description: Sao Tome and Principe offers a range of outdoor activities, from challenging hikes to relaxing beach days, catering to adventure seekers and nature lovers.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the islands’ volcanic landscapes and rainforests on foot.

activities.name: Pico Grande Hike
activities.description: A challenging hike to the summit of Pico Grande, offering stunning views.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, rain gear, water, snacks

activities.name: Obo National Park Trails
activities.description: Explore the diverse trails of Obo National Park, discovering unique flora and fauna.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters surrounding the islands with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Snorkeling & Diving
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life of the islands.

activities.name: Kayaking & Paddleboarding
activities.description: Explore the coastline and mangroves at your own pace.

clothing.yearRound: Versatile clothing suitable for warm and humid conditions
